# C Function

## Brief Description

The `C()` function is used to combine multiple vectors or lists into one composite vector or list.  

## What Package Contains It

The `C()` function is included in the basic R installation and is part of the language core. 

## When to Use It

The `C()` function is useful when combining multiple vectors or lists into one composite vector or list. It's also often used when creating factors from existing vectors. 

## An Example of How to Use It in R
